name: Pride and Prejudice
title: A classic novel by Jane Austen, following the tumultuous relationship between Elizabeth Bennet and Fitzwilliam Darcy.

name: To Kill a Mockingbird
title: Harper Lee's Pulitzer Prize-winning masterwork of honor and injustice in the deep South.
George Orwell's dystopian masterpiece, '1984' is a chilling prophecy about the future.

name: The Great Gatsby
title: F. Scott Fitzgerald's novel of the Jazz Age. It explores themes of decadence, idealism, and excess.

name: The Hobbit
title: J.R.R. Tolkien's delightful prelude to The Lord of the Rings, following Bilbo Baggins on an epic quest.

name: War and Peace
title: Leo Tolstoy's epic novel that intertwines the lives of five aristocratic families during the Napoleonic Wars.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
title: J.D. Salinger's classic novel of teenage angst and alienation, narrated by Holden Caulfield.

name: Dracula
title: Bram Stoker's iconic horror novel, telling the story of Count Dracula's attempt to move to England.

name: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
title: Yuval Noah Harari's landmark book, charting the entire history of humankind.

name: The Picture of Dorian Gray
title: Oscar Wilde's philosophical novel about a young man who sells his soul for eternal youth and beauty.

name: The Silent Patient
title: A shocking psychological thriller by Alex Michaelides about a psychotherapist and a silent patient.

name: The Midnight Library
title: Between life and death is a library, and within that library, the shelves go on forever. One book has the chance to try another life to see how things would be different.

name: Klara and the Sun
title: Kazuo Ishiguro's novel about Klara, an 'Artificial Friend' with outstanding observational qualities, who watches the world and learns about human nature.

name: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
title: Taylor Jenkins Reid's novel about a reclusive Old Hollywood movie icon who decides to give a final interview to an unknown magazine reporter.

name: Becoming
title: Michelle Obama's intimate, powerful, and inspiring memoir about her life, from her childhood to her time as First Lady of the United States.
